Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hey, I’ve been pretty good! I started doing the mindfulness exercises every morning.
That’s wonderful to hear! How has it been for you?
It’s been really helpful. I feel calmer throughout the day.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re finding a routine that works for you. Have you noticed any changes in your mood swings since incorporating mindfulness?
Yeah, I think they’ve gotten better. I feel like I can handle stress better now.
That’s a significant improvement! It shows that you’re making strides in managing your emotions. Have you had any challenging situations arise where you applied these techniques?
Yes, actually. I had a stressful day at work last week, but I used the breathing techniques, and it helped me stay calm.
That’s excellent! It sounds like you’re really integrating these strategies into your life. How did your coworkers react to your calmer demeanor?
They noticed! One of them even asked if I was on vacation or something.
That’s a great compliment! It shows that your efforts are having a positive impact not just on you but on those around you as well. Have you continued with your course research?
Yes, I signed up for one of the management courses, and I’m really enjoying it.
That’s fantastic! How do you feel about the material so far?
It’s interesting! I’m learning a lot about leadership styles and team dynamics.
Those are valuable skills to develop. Do you find that the course is helping you feel more confident in your current role?
Definitely! I feel like I’m gaining knowledge that I can apply right away.
That’s great to hear. It sounds like you’re making meaningful progress toward your career goals. Is there anything else you’d like to focus on today?
I’ve been thinking about my past a lot lately. I still have some regrets that come up.
It’s natural for those feelings to resurface. Would you like to explore those regrets and how they affect you now?
Yeah, I think that would be good. I just want to understand why they still bother me.
That’s a healthy approach. Can you share one of those regrets with me?
I regret not finishing school when I had the chance. I feel like I could have done more with my life.
It’s understandable to feel that way. Education can open many doors. How do you think that regret impacts you today?
I think it makes me doubt myself sometimes. Like, I wonder if I’m capable of achieving my goals.

It’s important to recognize that your past doesn’t define your future. You’re actively working toward your goals now, which is what matters. Would you like to set a goal related to this feeling of self-doubt?
Yeah, I think I’d like to focus on building my confidence more.
That’s a great goal. We can work on strategies to help you build that confidence over the next few sessions. Would that be okay?
Yes, that sounds good.
Wonderful! I appreciate your openness today. It’s been a pleasure to see your progress. Let’s check in on your confidence-building next time!
Thanks, Ellie. I feel good about this.
I’m glad to hear that! See you next time!
Bye!
